document_name: Law for the promotion of electricity generation with renewable sources
document_url: https://cdn.climatepolicyradar.org/NIC/2012/NIC-2012-01-01-Law for the promotion of electricity generation with renewable sources_beda9890b9df058040ed73ab6890086b.pdf
document_description: The Law no. 532 was passed in 2005 to promote electricity generation from renewable energy in the country. Sustainable biogas and biomass sources are included in the definition of renewable energy. Fiscal, economic and financial incentives that contribute to the development of renewables are adopted.  In 2015, the Law no. 901 amended Law no. 532 in order to ramp up new projects by increasing fiscal incentives. The Law no. 967, published on December 7th, 2017, extends the fiscal incentives to the extension of existing plants and the realisation of new projects to January 1st, 2023.On September 8, 2020, law no 1037 was adopted to amend energy prices and fees.
